dialogues.speaker: MRS. DUNNE
dialogues.text: Yes, Harry. I can't home school you anymore. So maybe it's time to make some new friends, some friends your own age...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I'm just not ready. Dejected, Harry starts back inside. Mrs. Dunne stops him.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. DUNNE
dialogues.text: Oh, I almost forgot. Captain Rob left this behind for you, he said count your steps very carefully. She hands him a rolled-up scroll. Harry brightens, his dr alive. He unrolls the scroll and we see his mother has dr map, with an "X" marking the school.

dialogues.text: (impressed)  Wow, a treasure map! What's the treasure?

dialogues.text: It could be anything. You're going to discover a whole new world when you get to school.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Wow just like Marco Polo.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. DUNNE
dialogues.text: I don't follow.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You know Mom, like in the pool. She acts like she gets it. They have a deep heart-felt hu

dialogues.text: I know I am, Mom.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. DUNNE
dialogues.text: Here's your lunch. And an apple and banana for extra energy.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (excited) Maybe the treasure's a chest full of apples and bananas!

dialogues.speaker: MRS. DUNNE
dialogues.text: Could be. Sweet boy. She tries to comb Harry's hair, but the COMB GETS STUCK.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Mom, you know that never works.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. DUNNE
dialogues.text: Right. She pats down his hair with her hands. Harry puts the ban pants pocket and starts walking right. MRS. DUNNE (cont'd) Other left. And now it's nine hundred sixty seven. Bye Harry! I love you!

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: (in the bowl, echoes) Thanks, Pop. RAY pulls the bowl off his head and dusts him off.

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD

dialogues.text: (full of pride) You sure are looking sharp there in your back to school outfit. RAY pulls out an old camera from lost and found. RAY (cont'd) Let me take your picture.

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: No can do. Gotta catch my bus. See ya, Pop!! We HOLD ON Ray as he watches Lloyd run off.

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: But you're already at school! (to himself) We go through this every year. He picks up and eats an old sandwich from the lost and fo

dialogues.text: Out of my way! Can't miss my bus! Gotta get to school! Then he tears off down the street. Some students look ba

dialogues.text: (counting steps, eating his apple) Seven hundred thirty two... bite number six... Follow the map, find a friend - how does the apple work into this. (he stops) This is distracting. One of these has to go. He looks at the map, he looks at the apple, then the map, apple. HARRY (cont'd) I sure hope I'm making the right decision. He looks at the apple again. HARRY (cont'd) Now take your seeds and grow into a beautiful pie. He tosses the apple. It lands in a yard where it hits a MEAN LOOKING DOG in th dog looks up, growls when he sees Harry and begins the ch attack mode. HARRY hears the growling dog, turns and after a swallowed running. The dog's overly long chain unravels as he gains on Harry

dialogues.text: Back on Harry as the dog is about to bite his ass. Then very quickly we see the chain stop the dog in mid-ai just as Harry rounds the corner and SMASHES HEAD FIRST IN looks very painful as they both fall to the ground. LLOYD shakes it off and holds his mouth. Harry's once co now permanently disheveled.

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: Somebody chipped my tooth. REVEAL his trademarked chipped tooth.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: How do you think I feel? Someone bit me in the forehead. REVEAL the piece of tooth is stuck in his forehead. Harry and tosses it away.

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: You could've saved that for the tooth fairy!

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: That's stupid! I happen to know my mom is the tooth fairy.

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: Your mom is the tooth fairy? That is so cool!

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yeah, she must do all the flying around when I'm asleep. (extends his hand) HARRY Dunne.

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: No thanks, not hungry. Harry Dunne. Why does that name not sound familiar?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Probably because we've never met.

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: No, that's not it. Anyway - (extends his hand) LLOYD Christmas.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Here I am bragging my Mom is the tooth fairy, and I'm talking to Santa's kid!

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: I haven't seen you around here before.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Home school. Til today.

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: Home school? What's that?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I go to school where I live.

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: Me too! LLOYD sees his school bus pass. LLOYD (cont'd) Aw, I missed it. Now I gotta walk.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (hold up map) I think it's just over there.

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: Is that what I think it is?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: No, it's a treasure map.

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: Cool.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: My mom says the treasure's somewhere in the school.

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: I don't know. I'm pretty familiar with the school and I've never seen that "X". But... I do know something.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (leans in) What?

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: (he tags him) You're it. LLOYD takes off.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (calls after him) I'm "it"? What's "it"? LLOYD stops.

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: I don't really know. But whatever  it is, it's something you don't want to be. And, right now, you are. He walks away. Harry catches up to him, and as they walk them tag back and forth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk through the crowd. Harry is pleasantly overwhel attractive girls.

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: High school is all about looking cool. So stick with me. They see a group of CHEERLEADERS.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (ga-ga) Wow. Are those cheerleaders, just like on TV? LLOYD turns Harry away from the girls as if avoiding home

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: Yeah, dangerous cult. Don't make eye contact or they might talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Don't we want them to talk to us?

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: (confidently) No no no no no.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: Well, besides cooties and other medical reasons, they're not in the cool crowd. Which I am, and you want to be. Know what I mean?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: No. HARRY turns and sees JESSICA, a beautiful seventeen-year- DRAMATIC MUSIC comes up, Harry is entirely in love. He sp very uncomfortable moments trying to remember how to brea HARRY (cont'd) What about her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a total dork. Just look how she dresses. LLOYD points to Jessica in her short, sexy skirt. LLOYD (cont'd) Check out her skirt, it's so short. I mean, where's the flood? He points at her tight shirt and ample cleavage. LLOYD (cont'd) And look at her shirt, it's not even buttoned right. Her milk bubbles are popping out! Loser! JESSICA drops something and picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Oh my gosh, I don't think she's even wearing underwear!

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: How nerdy is that? I'm wearing two pairs right now.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Me too! LLOYD raises his hand to high five. Harry doesn't know wh and in self defense, punches Lloyd in the chest. LLOYD goes in to poke him in the eye. They are about to (playfully) get into it when, suddenly, bumped from behind, as we reveal TURK, a LOST BOYS type w TOUGH GUY HAIRCUT. He reaches up and GRABS LLOYD by the n

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: (choked) This is my Injun friend, Turk. He's part of the cool crowd. (to Turk) Hey Kimosabe!

dialogues.speaker: TURK
dialogues.text: Shut up, ass face.

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: (proud) That's the Iroquois name he's given me because I have the strong face of an ass. TURK drags Lloyd away.  LLOYD (cont'd) See ya, Harry! Gotta have a little pow wow. HARRY is left alone for a moment. Looking down, he turns headfirst into JESSICA.

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: (to Harry) Hi.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (stumbling for something to say) Well I hope the carpet matches the drapes.

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (points to her newspaper) In the new library there.

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah. I don't think they do. You're new here, right?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Depends how you define 'new'...

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: You're the kid who was home schooled.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yeah. How'd you know?

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: I've been assigned to write an article about you for the school paper. It was either a feature on you or the new four-color ink pens at the student store.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Four colors? Neato!

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, I'd much rather write an expose or a hard hitting investigative piece, but nothing really ever happens around here. But, I chose you and that's fine. (she extends her hand) I'm Jessica Matthews.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY Dunne. HARRY has never had a part of a girl so close to him so h in awe of her hand for a long beat. Finally Harry gathers to shake her hand and just as they're about to touch, Tur with Lloyd in tow.

dialogues.speaker: TURK
dialogues.text: (laughs to Harry) Hey, freak show, did Jessica give you that banana in your pants? HARRY does in fact have a banana in his front pocket.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (looks down) Naw, my Mom did.

dialogues.speaker: TURK
dialogues.text: (grimacing) Gross!

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (pull's out his banana) Wanna bite?

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: TURK, leave him alone.

dialogues.speaker: TURK
dialogues.text: (mimicking Jessica) TURK, leave him alone. (to Harry) You're coming too. He pushes Harry away from Jessica.

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: (to Harry) Hey, Turk rescued you from the nerd. You're in!

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: (to Harry) I'll talk to you later. TURK leads Lloyd away with Harry.

dialogues.speaker: TURK
dialogues.text: (to Harry) So have you been held back two years like Lloyd?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (as if) No. I've been held back three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRINCIPAL COLLINS, the forty-something headmaster of this below average school, is there with the attractive, albei head lunch lady, MS. HELLER.

dialogues.speaker: MS. HELLER
dialogues.text: .+. and, Principal Collins, you'll be pleased to know that this year Wednesdays are "South of the Border" days. We'll serve a spicy tuna tamale along with a cheese quesadilla.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL COLLINS
dialogues.text: Good. Good. Good. Well, that's good. PRINCIPAL COLLINS gets up. PRINCIPAL COLLINS (cont'd) Well it sounds like it's going to be another hot year in the kitchen. They lunge at each other. They pull at each others clothe walls, fall to the floor and as Heller goes down.

dialogues.speaker: MS. HELLER
dialogues.text: God, I've missed you.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL COLLINS
dialogues.text: And I you. More kissing.

dialogues.speaker: MS. HELLER
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL COLLINS V.O
dialogues.text: (passionately) Yes. Yes. Oh yes. They hotly embrace and fall back behind the desk (Heller center drawer on the way down). There's a KNOCK ON THE DO FEMALE student, TALIA, enters and stands in the doorway, at the empty room.

dialogues.speaker: TALIA
dialogues.text: PRINCIPAL COLLINS? Hello? Still on his knees, he shoves Ms. Heller under the desk a the center drawer - this SLAMS INTO HELLER'S HEAD. PRINCIPAL COLLINS 0.S. Yes, what is it?  Collins doesn't appear.

dialogues.speaker: TALIA
dialogues.text: (slightly confused) Uhh, Sir it's time for morning announcements. Collins POPS UP, still on his knees, looking a little dis glasses askew.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL COLLINS
dialogues.text: Yes, I know dear. Well, why don't you do the announcements this morning.

dialogues.speaker: TALIA
dialogues.text: But what do I announce? He pops back up.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL COLLINS
dialogues.text: You announce the most important news of the day.

dialogues.speaker: TALIA
dialogues.text: Which is?

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL COLLINS
dialogues.text: (snaps) Make something up. She WALKS AWAY a bit confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collins comes out from behind the desk. Heller follows, z dress.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL COLLINS
dialogues.text: You know honey, I've finally figured out a way of bilking enough money from the school to get us that condo in Waikiki.

dialogues.speaker: MS. HELLER
dialogues.text: How baby-cakes? You've done it all.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL COLLINS
dialogues.text: Small potatoes. This one is big time. This is visionary. This idea is genius. She nuzzles up to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the big potato.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL COLLINS
dialogues.text: Yes, it's the big potato. Just have a look at this. He picks up a TATTERED GRANT BOOK. PRINCIPAL COLLINS (cont'd) The Richard Moffit Special Needs Grant. Unbelievable. This kid was in a Special Needs program, learned how to string a couple of sentences together and now he's some successful hot shot.

dialogues.speaker: MS. HELLER
dialogues.text: Like you. INSERT: There's a PHOTOGRAPH OF A MAN over the LISTING.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL COLLINS
dialogues.text: Anyway, the state is giving a hundred thousand dollars in his name to every school that has a special Needs class.

dialogues.speaker: MS. HELLER
dialogues.text: Oh, this is fantastic. So all we have to do is kill this Moffit guy and we get all the money!

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL COLLINS
dialogues.text: No. No. That's not it. We don't kill him. We don't kill anybody. But I like the way you're thinking. You're focused and you're trying to follow. No, what we need to do is start a fake Special Needs class.

dialogues.speaker: MS. HELLER
dialogues.text: We start our own class?

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL COLLINS
dialogues.text: Maybe someday. Aloha cold weather, aloha hot weather. MS. HELLER looks confused.

dialogues.speaker: MS. HELLER
dialogues.text: You said "aloha" twice.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL COLLINS
dialogues.text: Aloha means hello and goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: MS. HELLER
dialogues.text: Oh wow. Look at you. They hug.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL COLLINS
dialogues.text: Now, the problem is where do we find kids we can pass off as "special"? Out the window they see the back of Harry and Lloyd rise being hoisted up the flagpole by their underwear. PRINCIPAL COLLINS (cont'd) Bingo.

dialogues.speaker: MS. HELLER
dialogues.text: Times two.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL COLLINS
dialogues.text: (sneaky) I think you'll make a good teacher. MS. HELLER looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: MS. HELLER
dialogues.text: Me? Collins puts his arm around her and strokes her head. Ms. at him, he's not quite sure if she gets it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY and Lloyd look down at the school crowd below.

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: You know Harry, this is my favorite time of day.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yeah, it's nice. And your friend TURK is totally great.

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: Yeah, he's aces. (calling down) Thanks, Turk! HARRY sees Jessica in the crowd below looking up at them.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: God, she's beautiful. My wiener's all tingly.

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: (re: wedgie) Shift to your left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MS. HELLER is addressing the class.

dialogues.speaker: MS. HELLER
dialogues.text: Welcome to Special Needs orientation. I'm Ms. Heller, the lunch lady, ex, I mean your new teacher. Reveal Harry and Lloyd, beaming with pride, are the only there, and the classroom is actually just a corner of the he talks Lloyd takes notes, Harry copies. MS. HELLER (CONT'D) (cont'd) And the reason you two are here before the class officially starts is because you're 'extra' special. And were personally selected by PRINCIPAL COLLINS.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (to Lloyd) Who's Principal Collins?

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: The principal.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: MS. HELLER
dialogues.text: Your assignment is to pick the class. Find some other students just as special as you.

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: Will that be on the midterm?

dialogues.speaker: MS. HELLER
dialogues.text: No. LLOYD furiously erases all his notes, Harry follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY and Lloyd, with a TRAY OF FOOD, walk along a bad 70 the PYRAMIDS OF EGYPT.

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: You know, you're the first person I've brought here.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Oh, is this your special place?

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: No, I just usually eat my lunch on the crapper. Saves time. Out with the old, in with the new.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Can we eat there tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: Sure, but first we have to find kids special, needy and classy enough to be in Special Needs.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: It'll be like taking candy from a stranger. They sit and Harry picks up a clipboard with a sign-up sh "Special Needs". We see Harry and Lloyd's childish scrawl and second lines.

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: (sounding it out) HARRY...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: The second R is silent.

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: Oh, of course. Just then a SKATER PUNK limps by. LLOYD (cont'd) Look, a little crippled boy.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: His curse is our blessing. They walk over to Toby, a seventeen year old student on c looks perfectly healthy except for a CAST on both his leg

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: (speaking slowly) Hello, little orphan boy. What happened to you?

dialogues.speaker: TOBY
dialogues.text: Skateboard.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: One day they'll find a cure.

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: You brave soldier.

dialogues.speaker: TOBY
dialogues.text: What? It's nothing, the cast comes  off in six weeks.

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: (patronizing) Of course it does. (sotto to Harry) Obviously in denial. (to Toby) Maybe we can help.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: We're part of a special class taught by the lunch lady, er, I mean Ms. Heller. Maybe you'd like to join us, it doesn't require any walking.

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: And nobody will make fun of your horrible deformity.

dialogues.speaker: TOBY
dialogues.text: How much homework is there?

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: That's the downside. There is none.

dialogues.text: LLOYD gets a brain freeze. Harry keeps slurping. LLOYD (cont'd) Owww.

dialogues.text: I don't know. Owwww.

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: Maybe I should go home and grade papers. Owwww. They sip harder. Their eyes twitch as the pain sears thro heads.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: My head is suddenly killing me. Maybe it's from all the learning today.

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: Put some ice on it. He sips some more.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Owww.

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: And my mouph is frozen. JESSICA jogs over. She's wearing tight running shorts and bikini top.

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: Hey guys.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Heddo Jeth-ica. Because of the brain freeze, Harry and Lloyd both talk to slurred speech and drooling a little. Jessica talks to th like they're slow.

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: HARRY, I heard Collins has you in  some kind of special class.

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: If dou're trying to get in, dou're doo late.

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: Oh no, I know that class isn't for me. But I'm happy for you guys.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Do you thill want to do an arwticle on me, Jethica?

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: Yes, you and the whole Special Needs class.

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: Why ith dat newth?

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: This school's never had one before. I'd like to talk to you and all your special friends.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Tomorrow we go on a fee-eee-ece- wald twrip.

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: A field trip? Maybe I'll join you. See you tomorrow. She jogs off, her tight shorts and top bouncing as she go

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: There she goes, now wearing nothing but her underwear.

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: What a nerd. I don't know where that girl's ever gonna find a husband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRINCIPAL COLLINS and Ms. Heller are in his office. It's on in the building. Don Ho's "Tiny Bubbles" plays on a re Ms. Heller wears a coconut bra and a grass skirt. She doe Collins. He sips his tenth umbrella'd drink and snaps a P

dialogues.text: Knock knock.

dialogues.text: (modelling) Guess what"s under these coconuts.

dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.text: It's a surprise.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL COLLINS
dialogues.text: Well I've got a little surprise for you.

dialogues.speaker: MS. HELLER
dialogues.text: You got the Extender?

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL COLLINS
dialogues.text: No. No. I heard from Superintendent ZIMMER this morning and evidently he's so impressed with our Special Needs class, he's bringing Richard MOFFIT himself to the Thanksgiving Day parade- check in hand.

dialogues.speaker: MS. HELLER
dialogues.text: Monkey, this is too exciting! I can't believe our dream is coming true. Collins picks up a POLAROID CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL COLLINS
dialogues.text: Smile sweetheart. He snaps a shot of Ms. Heller's chest. He waves it dry. PRINCIPAL COLLINS (cont'd) More pictures for the chest. He opens a chest by his desk and drops the photos into it

dialogues.speaker: MS. HELLER
dialogues.text: So what do you keep in there?

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL COLLINS
dialogues.text: Oh, things. Photos. Tapes. I tape everything that goes on in this office.

dialogues.speaker: MS. HELLER
dialogues.text: Everything?

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL COLLINS
dialogues.text: Everything. Just for the record. He hits the stop button on small tape recorder in an ope desk. He ejects the tape and puts it into the wooden ches

dialogues.text: Oh, just like the President.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL COLLINS
dialogues.text: Just like the President. Angle holds on the chest, which Collins has left unlocked

dialogues.speaker: EXT. BIG 'A' GAS N' STUFF
dialogues.text: LLOYD runs up and sees Harry, who's dressed like a QUEEN, tiara and flowing gown made from a drape.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: LLOYD, where've you been? I've been waiting forever. I'm so embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: Sorry. Why are you dressed like a Queen! ?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: -..cause you said...

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: HARRY, I said don't ‘dress like a Queen"!

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (getting it) Oh... that makes much more sense. I had a heck of time getting these drapes from my mom. You don't want to know where I put the cord.

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: (interrupting) HARRY! Here he comes. We see Cale the clerk closing up the store. Lloyd and Har Cale turns and sees Lloyd the Ninja and Harry the Queen. LLOYD (cont'd) So you're out of the store, huh?

dialogues.speaker: CALE
dialogues.text: Yeah, we're closed. So go away.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (holding back the urprise) Actually we have something for you.  LLOYD taps him lightly on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: You're it! The Ninja and the Queen run away laughing maniacally. Cal confused and hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JESSICA, carrying a camera, approaches Ms. Heller getting car.

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: MS. HELLER, mind if I tag along on your field trip? I'm thinking of doing a story on your special needs class.

dialogues.speaker: MS. HELLER
dialogues.text: I'm not interested. Not after the smear story you did on my chicken sushi.

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: Well, when 200 students are hospitalized with stomach cramps I think it's newsworthy.

dialogues.speaker: MS. HELLER
dialogues.text: Nevertheless, you could have mentioned the sauce. (noticing camera) Well, I see you have a camera.

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: So can I come along?

dialogues.speaker: MS. HELLER
dialogues.text: (grabs the camera) No. JESSICA notices something under Ms. Heller's shirt.

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: Are you wearing a coconut bra?

dialogues.speaker: MS. HELLER
dialogues.text: Oh, you're good.

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: Why are you teaching Special Needs? You're the lunch lady.

dialogues.speaker: MS. HELLER
dialogues.text: Dietician! This interview is over. You can have the camera back  tomorrow. Come by the classroom. Heller heads off.

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: You mean the lunch room? Heller stops and turns back to her.

dialogues.speaker: MS. HELLER
dialogues.text: Well played. MS. HELLER storms away, leaving a confused Jessica.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LLOYD unrolls the map. Behind them there is a 'SLOW CHILD sign.

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: According to the map, we're just about at school.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yeah, but we still haven't found any treasure. A long yellow school bus is parked in front of the school Chong and Carl stand next to the front door.

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: I think we may have found something even better. The bus now appears to be GETTING LONGER! Then we see tha actually a long bus PARKED BEHIND a SUPER-SHORT BUS. SFX: Majestic chorus. They look like they've seen the Holy Grail (if they knew was). LLOYD (cont'd) Look! Look! The short bus is even shorter than a regular short bus. I suited to the Special Needs class, as it only has three r Harry and Lloyd run up to it.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: Our own special bus.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: How do you know it's for us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duh. The cool kids sit in the back of the bus. Here, every row is in the back. We're all cool! LLOYD and Harry run in. Lloyd runs as fast as he can down aisle, and smacks into the back of the bus. LLOYD (cont'd) (brings head up - giddy) It's even shorter than I imagined! HARRY runs smack into the back of the bus.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Are you sure? It feels about right to me. LLOYD gets up and again runs into the back of the bus.

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: Nope. I was right.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Wanna bet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the parking lot, Jessica approaches the Special needs congregating outside the short bus. Over the following, w hear the thumping of Harry and Lloyd smash into the back

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: TURK, what are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: TURK
dialogues.text: special Needs class.

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: Being a jerk doesn't make you special.

dialogues.speaker: TURK
dialogues.text: You're just jealous.

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: And, Ching Chong, you're not a Special Needs kid. You're just a foreign exchange student.

dialogues.speaker: CHING CHONG
dialogues.text: (defiant) I ride with my man. She hugs Turk and buries her face in his chest.

dialogues.speaker: TURK
dialogues.text: (to Jessica) This is the greatest class ever, don't ruin it. They start to board the bus as Ms. Heller approaches.

dialogues.speaker: MS. HELLER
dialogues.text: (to Jessica) I thought I told you to get lost.

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: Look Ms. Heller, there's something fishy here, and I don't think it's Friday's special.

dialogues.speaker: MS. HELLER
dialogues.text: I wouldn't know. Being that I'm just the teacher and all. MARGIE, the BUS DRIVER, a crotchety old matron in her ear passes Ms. Heller and boards the bus.

dialogues.speaker: MARGIE
dialogues.text: You ever have one of those days when you just want to drive the bus into a wall and end it all? (then) Okay, everyone in. MS. HELLER follows her on and slams the door in Jessica's looks determined. She's found her story!

dialogues.text: MS. HELLER sits behind Margie as she starts the engine.

dialogues.speaker: MS. HELLER
dialogues.text: Let's go Margie. The museum ain't going to teach itself.

dialogues.speaker: MARGIE
dialogues.text: Museum huh, haven't been there since my husband left me. I love art. She throws it in gear and pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the bus heads up the street, Jessica hops into her PAR WAGON, which is actually three or four feet LONGER than t

dialogues.speaker: MARGIE
dialogues.text: (laughs) Fun stuff. She drives on - BURNING RUBBER! We see that Jessica is fo

dialogues.text: Looking for a scoop, huh? I'll give you a scoop... of short bus. (to Margie) Lose her!

dialogues.text: Loser... oh yeah he was a loser alright. A big loser.

dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.text: He was a big loser! What are you deaf! ?

dialogues.text: Uh, no and I don't appreciate...turn down here! MARGIE yanks the wheel, making a sharp turn to the left. as it passes. And pick it up further down the street. Our inside a RECORD STORE as we see the bus make a hard right followed by Jessica.

dialogues.text: SIDE OF THE BUS as the big 'No Passing' SIGN FLIPS OUT, c Jessica's windshield. She almost HITS IT then slows.  MARGIE O.S. Yeah it started with a pass...

dialogues.speaker: MARGIE
dialogues.text: -.."hi cutie, nice knockers", then same old same old.

dialogues.text: Oh, yeah he was straight all right, just wasn't very good in the sack. I used to give him directions. Higher, lower, faster, harder, small circles, do the alphabet. Useless.

dialogues.text: REAR OF THE BUS, red lights flash, sign reads: 'No Passin Lights Flash'. The road narrows so Jessica must again fal behind her.

dialogues.speaker: MS. HELLER
dialogues.text: Left here! Left!

dialogues.text: You bet I left him, took the dog and we was history. MS. HELLER sees a tiny alley between two buildings. They power-sliding down an alley, Jessica misses the turn and eighty.

dialogues.text: (looking behind them) Ha! Too big to make the turn!

dialogues.speaker: MARGIE
dialogues.text: No, it actually fit quite nicely. (then) Well, except for the fact that it wasn't really as long as it was wide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They do a rough turn and exit the alley. Ms. Heller look Jessica.

dialogues.speaker: MS. HELLER
dialogues.text: I think you did it.

dialogues.speaker: MARGIE
dialogues.text: Damn right I did it. Went back and set the house on fire, his little floozy testified in court - and I ended up doing ten years at Rikers, got my teeth knocked out by Mike the Dyke.

dialogues.speaker: MS. HELLER
dialogues.text: (now paying attention) What the hell are you talking about? ANGLE ON: Lloyd, Harry and Carl. Once again, Carl is star better, he notices his surroundings.

dialogues.text: Hey, I'm not supposed to be on the short bus. I've got a Calculus class.

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: (to Harry, whimsical) He's a dreamer.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: No, actually I think I'm all better. ANGLE ON: Heller. IN THE MIRROR, she sees Jessica pull up

dialogues.speaker: MS. HELLER
dialogues.text: Turn here! Go, go, go! And she SLAMS her foot on Margie's gas pedal, as Margie m through a DIRT CONSTRUCTION SITE.

dialogues.text: In the lot, the bus leaves a trail of dust as Jessica's c

dialogues.text: A serene moment before a far away scream is heard, then t CRASHES THROUGH A FENCE, fully launched in the air! While in the air, our angle FLOWS INTO the bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In ULTRA-SLOW MOTION, it's ZERO GRAVITY as we TRACK thro see: MARGIE'S UNFAZED, but her dentures FLOAT OUT OF HER MOUTH frozen in a scream, legs in the air. As CARL floats past past LEWIS, CHING CHONG and TURK who are in a jumble of a CARL continues on to HARRY and LLOYD who act as if they a 13, tongue's out both chasing the same FREEZE-DRIED ICE C together almost for a KISS, then grossed out, break apart from their lunch bags is floating around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We BURST OUT of the bus as it LANDS ROUGHLY ON THE STREET CARL hard against the back window, followed by a mess of and Margie's dentures that get slammed against the window sandwiched by half of a peanut butter sandwich. The Short on.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (re: bus ride) Again, again! Everyone shouts "Again!".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lands even more roughly, and must LOCK UP HER BRAKES backs into her path. Beyond the truck she sees the Short away. She's defeated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE SEE the bus on the street outside the glass doors.

dialogues.speaker: MS. HELLER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Here we are. The kids file inside. They are disheveled, covered in foo tripping, Carl's back to his old, cloudy way - you get th TWO PASSERSBY, a MAN and a WOMAN, notice the motley crew.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: (sympathetic) special needs.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: Well, aren't they just so sweet.

dialogues.speaker: MS. HELLER
dialogues.text: Everyone find a partner. You're not any good to me dead. The class ad-libs partnering up: Turk with Ching Chong, T Terri, Lewis with Carl. Harry and Lloyd look around nervo partner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh oh. Captain Rob's always been my partner.

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: Sucks for you.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Who's your partner?

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: (looks around at the obviously partnered class) I don't know. I haven't decided yet.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Well... Uh...maybe... jeez, how can I say this... you and I could...perhaps ...maybe...uh... partner up?

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: You and me? Dream on, desperado.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Oh. Sorry. You're right, field trip partner is a big commitment.

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: I'm kidding! Of course I'll be your partner. LLOYD puts his arm around Harry and they head into the mu LLOYD (cont'd) You have some serious self-worth issues, my ugly, stupid, pudgy little friend.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Stop it, you're embarrassing me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a giant white polar bear in menacing pose, arms bared.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I've always wanted to be a polar bear. Tall, strong, six stomachs. He's the most beautiful creature in the forest. REVEAL Harry and Lloyd looking up at the polar bear. Harr

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: That's a cow, Harry.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Well, I could go for a tall glass of polar bear milk right now. MS. HELLER ENTERS and corrals Harry, Lloyd, and the rest Needs class.

dialogues.speaker: MS. HELLER
dialogues.text: Okay, class, everyone gather round. Mr. Collins wants a picture to prove you were here. (catching herself) And to cherish. She unfurls a banner, and hands it to Turk and Ching Chon reads "SPECIAL NEEDS CLASS FIELD TRIP 1986". She spots a nearby MUSEUM DOCENT. MS. HELLER (cont'd) Excuse me, Do you mind? She hands her camera to the Docent who snaps their photo. MS. HELLER (cont'd) Good, got it. (to docent) How long is the average field trip here?

dialogues.speaker: DOCENT
dialogues.text: To fully experience all we have to offer? Maybe two hours.

dialogues.speaker: MS. HELLER
dialogues.text: Alright. I'll be back in four. Give them the tour twice and talk slowly. She puts the camera away and walks off.

dialogues.speaker: DOCENT
dialogues.text: (to class) Okay, okay, listen up everybody. Welcome to the Shea Museum of Natural History. Where your journey into the past comes alive! She turns and faces the polar bear. DOCENT (cont'd) (bad acting polar bear) Grrr. Roar. Grrr. My name is Ursus Maritmus and I live in parts of Northern Canada and the Antarctic. Grr. Roar. Grr. I  rely on a keen sense of a smell to sniff out prey. My long neck helps me view my habitat and pluck fish from the sea. Roar. Glub glub. Roar. She turns back around in a menacing polar bear pose and s gone except for Harry and Lloyd. DOCENT (cont'd) Uh-oh scared them away. Too many "Roars." The young boy raises his hand.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG BOY
dialogues.text: (points) What's his name?

dialogues.speaker: DOCENT
dialogues.text: (impatient) Like I said, Ursus Maritimus.

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: (to boy with authority) That's not a real name. His parents called him "Snowy".

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG BOY
dialogues.text: What's his name? He points to a Snow Fox.

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: Also Snowy.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG BOY
dialogues.text: I like his answers better.

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: (to the Docent) LLOYD Christmas - Special Needs. I'll take over from here ma'am. She just eyes him passively then walks away. LLOYD (cont'd) (to kid) You see, the animal kingdom is actually very simple. Everything is named Snowy, at least in cold climates. On the other hand, "Scorchy" over here... LLOYD points to a camel in a desert exhibit and leads the leaving Harry alone, entranced by the polar bear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JESSICA ENTERS, we see out the doors that her car is park bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JESSICA enters the gallery. She approaches Harry who is s staring at the polar bear.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: MS. HELLER said not to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: That's because Ms. Heller doesn't want you to know this whole thing is a scam.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: A-ha! I had a feeling it was all a fake.

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: You did?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yeah. Look at this polar bear. It hasn't moved in half an hour. And those Eskimos over there...I'm sure at least one of them is a mannequin.

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: Oh Harry, you're so funny. Now I have something that's kind of delicate...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Oh, you want to talk about your delicates?

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: Are you trying to be funny? Or are you actually re--, re...special

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: We're all special. Everyone Lloyd and I chose for the class is special.

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: You and Lloyd chose the class!? JESSICA, thinks a moment as she figures things out.  JESSICA (cont'd) This is starting to make more sense. Just then, Jessica sees Turk walking down a corridor towa he's goofing around with Lewis and Ching Chong. JESSICA (cont'd) We can't really talk here. Can you come to my house tonight?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (stunned) Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: Come over around seven.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: O'clock?

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Gotcha. JESSICA walks off. HARRY (cont'd) (sotto) A date.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON the empty hallway. WE HEAR muffled voices from a dust falls into frame then ABRUPTLY, Harry and LLOYD fall front of us from above. With some plaster ceiling followi loved the fall, Lloyd doesn't much care.

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: Sorry about that Harry, first time I've brought a friend up there. You okay?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yea! LLOYD throws a ceiling piece back up and they walk on. HARRY (cont'd) So Lloyd, you gotta help me. A real live date with a real live girl.

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: Who cares? Chicks are for fags.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I think she wants me to come over to put me into the right position to check out her delicates, what ever that means.

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, buddy, you're gonna get "some".

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Some what?

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: You know... She's gonna be all over you like a barrel of monkeys, with her tight shirt and short skirt... Eeeww, it's so faggy I can't even talk about it.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Come on, Lloyd. You must know someone I can talk to.

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: Sure I do. On one condition.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You can't marry my mom.

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: It's really not up to you, Harry. But we just want you to feel like you're part of the decision.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Shut up!

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: Alright, if you really want to go down this road, well girl's like chocolate.

dialogues.text: Tight on a candy vending machine. HARRY sees CHOCOLATE BA behind the glass, among other edible goodies including CL OF PEANUTS called: SONNIE JEWEL PEANUTS, and next to it - CRUMBLE He puts in some coins and presses what he thinks chocolate is. But he's off by one and the peanuts next to drops down. He tries again. And the Violet Crumble drops some lifesavers fall. He tries again. Nope. Baked apple p more coins...

dialogues.text: The vending machine is almost completely empty -- except chocolate bars. Snack goods fill the dispenser tray and s the floor around Harry. He reaches in and is out of coins he reaches up into the candy return at the bottom. After the look on his face tells us he's stuck. Maybe forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY's arm is now incredibly jammed half-way up INTO THE twisted into a pretzel, and just as he's about to grab a chocolate bars from the rack inside. Then the whole machi DOWN ON HIM. CLOSE ON: His hand reaching out, grabs some of the prized bars and Sonnie Jewel Peanuts that have spilled on the fl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: That's it. Build him a float for the Thanksgiving Day parade! modifying the float-sketch - it's scribble.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: LLOYD, what I'm saying is we may already have what we want. LLOYD takes a long look at Collins' photo, then at Washin He smiles at Harry.

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: Oh. I get it now. Once again he raises his hammer to take another swing, an restrains him, the two share an awkward moment.

The bleachers are full of students and towns watching. Cheerleaders carry a banner reading, "PROVIDENC SCHOOL THANKSGIVING 1986".

dialogues.text: No... no it's not horse, you see I sold the horse. Behind the boy, Ray is driving a Cadillac convertible, wa crowd. A sign on the car reads "Custodian of the Year". A READS: 'Buy Original Ray's WAX - made from real ketchup a

dialogues.text: Sorry I'm late but I woke up tied to the bed and... He see's Washington/Collins eyebrows. LEWIS (cont'd) Hey - that's my hair! Someone cut it while I slept! HARRY and Lloyd ‘act casual’ whistle and look around. The closer in towards the float and we see: Washington's/Coll outstretched hand has been replaced with a pirate's hook the heating duct. There's a large sign that reads, "PRINC and the original treasure chest is now prominently displa the float. The whole thing is attached to Lloyd's waxer w Harry and Lloyd walk to the side of the boat

Reveal Ching Chong at the treasure chest looking through first time Ching Chong speaks in a perfect American Accen CHING CHONG (cont'd) You won't believe these documents. They provide evidence of a long history of fraud and embezzlement from the school by Principal Collins and Ms. Heller, a.k.a. the Lunch Lady.

dialogues.text: Well you know Detective, he's expecting (fingers in quotes) 'Moff£it' to be someone who has... certain... well...

dialogues.text: I'd like to introduce you to Richard Moffit - former Special Needs student and now American success story. He gestures to MR. MOFFIT, who is mid 30's. Collins notic only wearing one shoe, the other foot is bare.

dialogues.text: (shrugs, then quietly) What're you gonna do. At least today he remembered his pants. (then, to Moffit) Richard, this is Principal Collins. PRINCIPAL COLLINS takes Moffit's hand and shakes it - doe Collins sees a folded paper in his pocket (check?) .

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL COLLINS
dialogues.text: Mr. Moffit, it's a great pleasure to meet you sir. And is that what I think it is...? MOFFIT pulls the paper out of his pocket, it is a CHILD L AN AIRPLANE.

dialogues.text: Yes! I drew this. Collins looks at Zimmer. Zimmer puts hands in air as 'quo

dialogues.text: (whispers) special Needs.

dialogues.text: Aren't you going to present to the grant check today.

dialogues.speaker: MOFFIT
dialogues.text: I can turn on all the faucets in my house. (close to Collins) Even the hose.

dialogues.speaker: ZIMMER
dialogues.text: (to Moffit) But we don't drink from the house do we. Collins reacts uncomfortably to all this... ANGLE ON a few other floats and a band pass. CLOSE-ON MARGIE the bus driver.

dialogues.text: (leaning out window) Move it will ya! C'mon I got better things to do. REVEAL she's driving the SPECIAL NEEDS BUS that is now PU SPECIAL NEEDS FLOAT - with the ENTIRE CLASS riding it. Sh the band ahead of her.

dialogues.text: Oh, here it comes. You're gonna love what the children have done. CLOSE ON Harry and Lloyd on the float.

dialogues.text: Roger that, Wilco. HARRY grabs two rods which are attached to the Collins fl operates the mouth. Lloyd hits a tape recorder button and voice comes booming out of speakers.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERINTENDANT ZIMMER
dialogues.text: Is that a float of you, Collins? Why are you a pirate? BACK TO FLOAT where we continue to hear Collins' voice bl speakers that ARE ATTACHED TO THE FLOAT.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL COLLINS VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: We've done it all. Trilingual education... twelve hundred dollars for fake mock government... twelve hundred charging tuition... Just then police cars zoom up and screech to a halt. TWO OFFICERS jump out with Jessica.

dialogues.text: Oh, good. There's Jessica.

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: How could she miss this? This whole salute to Collins was her idea. ANGLE ON bleachers again.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL COLLINS
dialogues.text: I don't know what those kids are doing. Nothing they do makes any sense. That's why we started the special Needs class. (sees police) And that's why we need that check! Collins grabs the check... ANGLE ON The float. Harry and Lloyd see Collins running a

dialogues.text: Hey there goes Principal Collins!

dialogues.text: Well, that's too bad, this is his day. Collins sees the police coming from the other direction, around and starts running back - towards the float. HARRY (cont'd) Oh, good, he's reconsidered. HARRY waves at Jessica, dropping the hydraulic rod connec pirate hook. Just then, Collins runs by, and get's caught hook. HARRY resumes his rod motion - which raises Collins Held only by the back of his jacket. REVEAL Collins - now THE HOOK of the Pirate Collins float. HELLER SEES this an make a hasty retreat out the back, turns face to face wit a BURLY POLICEMAN.

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA

dialogues.text: (yelling) I did it all for the children... The crowd laughs and points. Moffit acts as if he got fre his ice cream.

dialogues.text: Oh my God! She's two-timing

dialogues.text: The boy's walk away from a school parking lot.

dialogues.text: Ya know Harry, I think this whole experience has soured me on women.

dialogues.text: I don't think that'll happen. We've learned a valuable lesson we won't ever forget. They hear a loud honk, turn to see a COOL 4 SEATER SPORTS HOT IDENTICAL TWIN GIRLS in matching sexy outfits.

dialogues.text: Excuse us... You're Harry and Lloyd right?

dialogues.text: sure! HARRY steps forward, but is quickly stopped by Lloyd.

dialogues.text: (whispers to Harry) Hold up. First, we have to decide who gets who, remember? No more competition?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (steps back) Right.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: The one on the left.

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: Damn! What are the odds?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.text: That's the one I wanted. They both look at the girls, as WE PAN from one to anothe a difference between them.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: She's one of a kind.

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: Try one in a million!

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Well, what should we do? LLOYD takes a beat figuring it out.

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: You take her.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (firm) No Lloyd. Chicks are for fags - I'm not going to do it. LLOYD takes a moment to figure it all out. Then makes the

dialogues.text: (to the girls)  Look, why don't you girls go on without us okay? HARRY smiles. The girls look confused. LLOYD walks closer on the left (in the passenger seat). LLOYD (cont'd) You may find a great guy like Harry someday - but I wouldn't count on it. (glance at the other girl - quickly) Oh, and I'm sure you're friend here is real sweet too. Hearing this, the girls are miffed, and speed away. The b up the GUTTER FULL OF MUD.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Thanks Lloyd. You're always looking out for me. LLOYD sees the mud coming his way.

dialogues.speaker: LLOYD
dialogues.text: Look out! LLOYD jumps out of the way PULLING HARRY IN FRONT of him. HARRY's upper body get's soaked in the MUDDY, POO-LIKE CO peeks out from behind muddy Harry. LLOYD (cont'd) Phew, that was close... HARRY - turns away, stepping into the street to wipe the face. HARRY starts to reply when he is HIT BY A CAR! Knocked ou

dialogues.text: HARRY screaming - seen through the windshield of the car The car comes to a rapid stop, as Harry holds on to the w wipers - his face pressed up tightly against the glass. S in wet mud - He open's his eyes.

dialogues.text: Charlie? REVEAL it's JESSICA'S DAD (Bob Saget)! Who can't help but out by the shit covered loser attached to his windshield. SCREAMS.

dialogues.text: Not you! Not again! Look what you've done! There's shit all over  my car! HARRY gets off the car as Lloyd APPROACHES.

dialogues.text: Hey, where'd you go? They see Jessica's Dad freaking out in the car as they st away. LLOYD (cont'd) What's with him?

dialogues.text: That's gross.
